questions.question: The Components of Fitness Are: Muscular Strength, Muscular Endurance, Cardiovascular Endurance, Flexibility, Body Comp

choices.answer: True
False
The body's ability to jump as high as possible.
The muscles ability to flex without stopping.
The amount a muscle can exert force against a resistance.
Being able to do 1,000,000 Jumping Jacks in 14 seconds.
My veins and livers ability to filter and clean blood.
How long you can flex your biceps in the mirror for.
The amount of times your heart beats per minute
My heart and lungs ability to supply oxygen to working muscle.
The ratio of fat to lean mass in the body.
The total pounds of fat and organs in the body.
How many bones make up the human skeleton.
The amount of muscle you can grow in a month.
How long it takes to run the 100 yard dash.
The muscles ability to repeat a movement over an extended time.
How long I can hold my eyes open without blinking.
How many pounds you can lift over head.
The joints ability to move through a full range of motion
How far you can drop without injuring a joint.
How much force a bone can handle before it breaks.
When you start falling over, but catch yourself before you do.

questions.question: I can improve my cardiovascular endurance by...

choices.answer: Eating a family sized bag of Doritos in one sitting.
Playing "Among Us" instead of doing this  Kahoot Review
Allowing social media to steal more of my attention today.
Jogging, Swimming, Biking, Hiking, or being active 30 min a few days a week

questions.question: I can improve muscular endurance by...

choices.answer: Doing activities that require me to repeat a muscle movement many times.
Lifting as much weight as possible just 1 time.
Swimming across the Atlantic Ocean.
Stretching Daily at the end of my workouts.
Pushing my joints as far as possible till it hurts (no pain... no gain)
Doing dynamic warm-ups, static stretches, yoga, and massaging my muscles.
Never warming up or cooling down because thats for "try hards".
Lifting heavy every day at the gym.

questions.question: I can improve muscular strength by...

choices.answer: Consistently working out and doing things that challenge myself.
Teaching my brain and muscles correct form for an exercise.
Letting my muscles have enough rest if I worked them really hard recently.
Doing heavier activities that make me work hard for 8-10 reps.

questions.question: I can improve/maintain body composition by...

choices.answer: Having a healthy balance of exercise and food intake.
Adding one more scoop of ice cream because why not...
Sitting/laying down all day and not trying to be active ever.
Seeking out for nutrient dense foods, controlling my junk food cravings.
I want to be be active and work towards improving my health.
I'm doing fine for now. I will worry about being active later in life.
I want to be healthy and active, but I don't know where to begin.
I'm not one for exercise and activity. If it ain't broke don't fix it.
